In the bustling town of Somnium, 16-year-old Nox Dushman spent most of his waking moments drifting off into vivid daydreams where he envisioned himself as a superhero with extraordinary abilities. In these fleeting escapes, Nox felt invincible, soaring through the skies and confronting corporate villains who sought to monopolize the economy. However, reality was farfrom the fantastical world he daydreamed about. At home, he faced the relentless taunts of his older brother, Mawulf, who reveled in bringing Nox down with his intimidating fistfights.

One day, while daydreaming, Nox imagined a clash with a shadowy figure who possessed the power to control time itself. Confronted by this formidable foe, Nox discovered an unexpected surge of energy—his daydreams had inadvertently transferred this power into reality. Eager to test this newfound ability, Nox found himself facing Mawulf in a confrontation at the local park. As their fists clashed, Nox suddenly leapt into the air, time slowing around him. With his newfound power, he managed to overpower Mawulf, an act that both fascinated and terrified him.

Following this, a mysterious figure named Elian emerged in town, known for his ability to manipulate minds. His motives were shrouded, and his presence only deepened Nox’s daydreams as he pictured himself facing off against this ominous figure. Amidst the tensions, daydreams became Nox’s sanctuary from a reality becoming ever more complex.

When reality and fantasy began to blur, Nox found himself at the epicenter of a climactic showdown. As mind games with Elian mounted, Nox’s grip on reality weakened, and his daydreams became the only place where he felt safe. In a final confrontation where fists flew and minds were conquered, Nox realized that the true battle was not of fists but of self-doubt and fear. Armed with his experience and the guidance of his daydreams, Nox conquered both illusions and reality, integrating the powers he once only imagined into his everyday existence. In the silence of victory, Nox acknowledged growth, pulling not just from the unfettered world of his imagination but from the harsh realities he faced.

In the bustling town of Cedarville, 17-year-old Ben Dellinger spends most of his high school days drifting through classes, lost in vivid daydreams where he envisions himself as a daring adventurer, navigatingizzare worlds fraught with mystery and danger. These mental escapes offer him a respite from his mundane life, where every day seems like Groundhog Day. During his recurrent daydreams, Ben fantasizes about discovering hidden treasures, meeting mythical heroes, or uncovering secrets long concealed. Intrinsically, these fantasies reflect his deep-seated desire for a life filled with purpose and excitement, something far removed from his predictable reality.

One ordinary afternoon, while daydreaming in his history class about conquering a fictional kingdom, the serene bubble of his imagination is rudely shattered by a confrontation between two rival groups in the school cafeteria. Engaged in a heated and intense fistfight, the students' emotions are palpable, and it draws the attention of the entire school. As Ben watches, mesmerized, he finds himself unexpectedly pulled into the fray. With reflexes guided by an instinct he can't explain, he intervenes, employing moves he has practiced in his daydreams with natural ease and agility.

In the heat of the commotion, Ben discovers an unexpected surge of agility and strength. With deceptive quickness and unorthodox combat skills, he brings order to the chaos, managing to calm the situación without susto causando daño. As the fight subsides, the students around him stare in awe, surprised by his seemingly supernatural abilities.

This singular event transforms Ben’s life forever. His latent superpowers, once confined to the realm of his imagination, are now uncontestably real. As the news of his heroics spreads like wildfire across the town, Ben finds himself at the center of a whirlwind, drawn into a world where his dreams and reality intersect in the most astonishing ways. Eager to understand and control his newfound abilities, Ben joins a clandestine organization known only as “The Guides,” a group dedicated to uncovering the origins and uses of emerging powers.

As Ben trains with The Guides, he enters a world where daydreams blend with real-life adventure. Each challenge he faces, each battle he wins, forces him to grapple with the weight of responsibility and the true meaning of heroism. Internally, Ben must reconcile his aspirational fantasies with the harsh realities of his new life. Through triumphs and setbacks, Ben learns to balance his extending abilities with wisdom, empathy, and the value of teamwork, inspiring those around him with his courage and determination.

Throughout his journey, Ben comes to realize that true heroism isn't just about power, but about the heart that drives one to embrace the complexities of the world, just as it is—filled with beauty, complexity, and hope for a better future.
